column1: indian_feudal_desc;The event resulted in a collapse of the central government's authority in the Indian subcontinent. Nevertheless
column2: the remnants of the government managed to survive the event in isolated regions
column3: and soon became much more feudal in structure
column4: with ministers effectively having the power of monarchs. It is primarily focused around moving power upwards to the ducal
column5: kingly and imperial levels by treating the lowest of vassals in a manner more akin to regional governors than true feudal vassals. Compared to feudal states
column6: the ruler is somewhat restricted by the rule of law when dealing with their vassals.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: successor_desc;This character is one of the former generals and vassals of the conqueror of Rajasthan
column2: who died early in his reign.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: crowned_indian_feudal_desc;This character has been lawfully crowned monarch by the will of the people.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
axe_of_devendra_desc;The famous axe of Devendra Purandar
column2: a ruler who raided almost all of Maharashtra.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: rajasaurus_skull_desc;The skull of a demon named Rajasura
column2: slain by the gods in ancient times.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: varunastra_desc;A legendary weapon whose power comes from Varuna
column2: the god of the sea. It is said to be able to destroy any target using the power of the seas contained within it.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: agneyastra_desc;A mythical weapon whose power comes from Agni
column2: the god of fire. Legends say it can emit flames inextinguishable by normal means.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: suryastra_desc;An dazzling weapon said to be imbued with the power of Surya
column2: the god of the sun. It is decribed by some to be so bright that its light that would dispel any darkness.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: mansifid_desc;A mighty warrior and staunch defender of Islam
column2: he defeated the armies of three Hindu Kings at once
column3: saving Bengal from the heathen hordes.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: purandara_bloodline_desc;A minor king who subjugated the warring states of Southern India and united the chaotic region under one massive empire.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
laskandar_bloodline_desc;The great conqueror who established a realm stretching from Maharashtra to the Indus River.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

gangaraja_bloodline_desc;The greatest ruler of the Sharma dynasty that once dominated north India. His reign is widely regarded as a golden age that brought stability and prosperity to the realm.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
emulate_bhagavanist_ruler_timer_tooltip;Has not picked a ruler in 10 years;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
british_invasion_desc;We can wage a war to bring the Indian lands under the Queen's authority;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
unite_the_ganges_desc;Reform the ancient empire of the Sharma dynasty
column2: centred around the Ganges river.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: form_himalayas_desc;Become the emperor of the mountains.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
expand_mughalstan_desc;It is said that the emperors of ancient Mughalstan ruled a realm stretching from the Indus in the west to Bengal in the east. By controlling these regions
column2: the newly-reestablished empire of Mughalstan can claim sovereignty over these lands.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: unite_the_ganges_TOOLTIP;Control the entirety of the de-jure Gangetic Empire;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
form_laskandar_empire_desc;Reunite the lands once conquered by Sikandar.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
form_laskandar_empire_tt;To be recognized as a true successor of Sikandar
column2: you must unite Rajasthan
column3: Gujarat and the Samudra under your rule before 2640.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: emulate_bhagavanist_ruler_desc;Bhagavanists can choose to emulate great bhagavanist rulers of the past.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC_cricket_game_start;The stadium has been prepared and the players have been summoned. It is time for the cricket match to begin!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTA_cricket_game_start;I will cheer my team on from the stands!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB_cricket_game_start;You know what? I'm going to join them on the pitch!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
TXT_EVTOPTB_cricket_game_start;You descend from the stands and join the game.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC_cricket_game_win;After several long and brutal overs
column2: my team finally emerges victorious. As my section of the stands erupts into cheers
column3: I cannot help but join in.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_cricket_game_win;I knew I was right to support them!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC_cricket_game_lose;After several long and brutal overs
column2: my team has been soundly defeated. As I hear the other section of the stands cheer in celebration
column3: I bury my head in my hands.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: my team finally emerges victorious! My hips are bruised purple
column3: but the cheering from the stands makes the pain evaporate.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC_cricket_game_personal_lose;Despite trying my absolute hardest to win
column2: my team has been soundly defeated. I collapse onto the floor
column4: as the crowd cheers for my opponents.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: and the attendees begin to return home. The people must surely have been pleased
column3: and it is thanks in large part to my own wealth and diligence.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: recent_cricket_game_desc;This character has recently held a game of cricket;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: a prestigious sport beloved of the masses;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: cricketer_desc;This character is an experienced cricket player;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
neoved1Desc;Which school of thought shall I follow?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
parabrahmanist6Desc;Which school of thought shall I follow?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTA_neoved1;I shall follow the path of the Mahatma;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the giver of wealth;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTC_neoved1;I wish to spread the glory of the Trimurti.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTA_neoved2;Smartism is the way to go;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB_neoved2;I shall become a devotee of Shakti;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
vaishnavist_hindu_desc;The Vaishnava are those who chiefly worship Vishnu
column2: the protector of the world and preserver of Dharma.;;;;;;;;x
the three-eyed lord
the great divine mother
column3: and the embodiment of power or energy.;;;;;;;;x

column2: Vishnu
column5: and hold them all in equal regard.;;;;;;;;x

column2: a great pre-event leader

column1: bhagavanist_shivaji_desc;This character admires Chhatrapati Shivaji of the Maratha empire
column2: and wishes to emulate him.;;;;;;;;x

column1: bhagavanist_rama_desc;This character admires the divine king Rama of Kosala
column2: and wishes to emulate him.;;;;;;;;x

column1: bhagavanist_akbar_desc;This character admires the pre-event emperor Akbar
column2: and wishes to emulate him.;;;;;;;;x

column1: bhagavanist_jagadisha_desc;This character admires the post-event emperor Jagadisha Sharma
column2: and wishes to emulate him.;;;;;;;;x

column1: bhagavanist_rajaraja_desc;This character admires the tamil king Rajaraja Chola
column2: and wishes to emulate him.;;;;;;;;x

column1: old_hindu_DESC;Hinduism is a blanket term for a variety of related traditions and practices found in the Indian subcontinent
column2: with a history going back millenia before the event. Post-event hindus worship various dieties
column6: and Shakti used to be prominent
column7: but local and minor gods have increased in importance over time
column8: and the goddess Lakshmi has seen an especial increase in importance. Gandhi began to be revered as a god
column9: while worship of Brahma was dropped altogether. Adherents of the faith hold that the event was caused by the god Kalki
column11: who destroyed the world because of its impious and decadent ways. The religion is based on a collection of religious scriptures known as a Vedas
column12: as well as various other post-vedic texts and a few post-event ones. They also believe that they reincarnate after death. A prominent aspect of the religion is adherence to the varna system
column13: where society is divided into castes.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: maunaxite_DESC;Not so much a faith as a blanket term for various disorganized cults and practices across eastern India. Adherents show no hesitation in raiding or even invading realms of heathen rulers.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
maunaxite_reformed_DESC;The Mahadharma represents a reformation and organization of the Dharmic Cults of eastern India
column2: adding a priestly hierarchy and formalised texts
column3: enabling it to more effectively resist the encroachment of other faiths. They principally believe that the event was caused by the rulers of the world growing too corrupt and thus Kalki struck down the Proud mankind as punishment for their corruption.;;;;;;;;x

column1: neovedantic_DESC;Neo-Vedanticism is a Hindu school of thought that advocates for the rejection of the Varna system and abhors discrimination on the basis of social class. They consider themselves the successors of a pre-event movement
column2: while other Dharmics think they emerged some time after the event. The word 'Neo-Vedantic' was originally used by their opponents to disparage them
column3: with the implication that they represented a break from tradition and hence were not authentically hindu. Neovedantics also differ in another crucial aspect: They consider Brahma
column4: Vishnu and Shiva as the three most important deities of hinduism (The Trimurti)
column5: while other devas are relegated to a more minor role. Kubera
column7: has been elevated in status by neovedantics
column8: and is widely worshipped by many of them.;;;;;;;;x

column1: parabrahmanist_DESC;The Bhagavanist religion came to dominate many parts of India in the chaos following the Event. Like pre-Event Hindus
column2: they venerate various gods
column3: but they view all gods as aspects of "Bhagavan"
column4: and it is from this distinctive idea that the sect gains their name. Bhagavanists believe that certain great rulers of the past also worshipped Bhagavan
column5: and adherents hold these rulers in high regard

column1: form_indian_empire_desc;Unite the vast lands of India under your rule;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC_laskandar_restoration;Originally a minor ruler in Maharashtra
column2: Sikandar of Bandra found inspiration in the tales of a certain pre-event emperor called Shivaji
column3: whose empire is said to have stretched from sea to sea. At a relatively young age
column4: he managed to subjugate the lands of western Maharashtra
column6: and Rajasthan. As time wore on
column7: parts of his realm gradually broke away until only Rajasthan remained
column8: and that too was gone upon his death. It seemed unlikely that anyone would become worthy of the title "Chhatrapati" again. Nevertheless
column9: you have remade Sikandar's shattered realm
column10: and it is said that rulers across the subcontinent regard you  with fear and awe. It is clear now that Sikandar lives on in the blood of his descendants.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: Triumphant;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC_mumbai_triumphant;Ever since the coast of Maharashtra was conquered by Yunaneshwar Desai
column2: Mumbai has remained in a desperate situation. The nobles that still remained after the war with the king fled to the city
column3: and elected a new ruler to be their protector against further incursions. Partly due to its location in the middle of a major trade route
column4: the ruling class soon turned to more mercantile pursuits
column5: and Mumbai grew rich. Of course
column7: son of the conquering Yunaneshwar and a victor in a brief civil war
column8: thought that this wealth would be better off in his hands. The protector of Mumbai was out of options
column9: so he negotiated an annual tribute to the King in return for leaving them alone. But now
column10: everything has changed. Mumbai has come to rule its old lands
column11: and it can finally claim to be a worthy successor to the old kingdom of the Samudra.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: indian_feudal_coronation_desc;Legitimize your authority as monarch by lawfully crowning yourself.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC_indian_feudal_coronation;Sitting on a throne atop a raised platform
column2: you see a large crowd gathered before you. You watch on as each person in the crowd writes your name on a slip of paper and puts it in a large box. The slips will be counted afterwards. The process takes hours
column4: an announcer proclaims the number of votes you have recieved to the waiting crowd. The exact number of votes doesn't matter: what does is the fact that you were lawfully chosen by the people to govern them.\n\nOnce the crowd has dispersed
column5: you turn to face your vassals gathered before you. You swear an oath affirming your duty towards the realm
column6: and they collectively swear an oath of loyalty to you. Finally
column7: an official places a golden crown on your head.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: OPT_A_indian_feudal_coronation;I will fulfill my duties as a monarch;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
